FuncDef:
The recycle ipv6-address command sets the status of IPv6 addresses to idle. In other words, you can configure the device to reclaim some IPv6 addresses.
By default, IPv6 addresses are not recycled.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the start IPv6 address to be reclaimed.
The address is a 32-digit hexadecimal number.

Specifies the end IPv6 address to be reclaimed.
The address is a 32-digit hexadecimal number.

Specifies the start IPv6 prefix.
The address is a 32-digit hexadecimal number.

Specifies the end IPv6 prefix.
The address is a 32-digit hexadecimal number.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The recycle ipv6-address command can be used to reclaim the IPv6 address of an offline user.
Configuration Impact
If the IPv6 address specified in the command is being used by an online user, running the command will log the user out for a short period of time.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
The command can only be run in a local prefix pool.
